trans-unit.source: Provides a base class for designers for data views based on hierarchical data.
This class must be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView> class is used by developers of custom data source designers.
Initiates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner"></xref> that is the designer for the associated control.
A unique path to the block of data to use for the view.
owner is `null`
-or-
viewPath is `null`.
Gets the associated designer.
The parent <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.IHierarchicalDataSourceDesigner"></xref>.
Generates design-time data that matches the schema of the associated data source control and returns a value indicating whether the data is sample or real data.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView.GetDesignTimeData%2A> method should provide a design-time version of data for use by the associated data-bound control designer.
It is not expected nor recommended that the designer perform actual data access at design time.
Instead, the designer should create sample data that matches the schema of the data source.
`true` to indicate the returned data is sample data; `false` to indicate the returned data is live data.
This implementation always returns `null`.
Gets the path to the block of data that is presented in the view.
The specific nature of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView.Path%2A> property is determined by the nature of the data.
For XML data, it would be an XPath query, but for other kinds of data it could be a URL or some other unique identifying path.
The path provided when creating the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView"></xref>.
Gets a schema that describes the data source view for the associated control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerHierarchicalDataSourceView.Schema%2A> property allows the control designer of a data-bound control to provide intelligent choices based on the design-time data source view that is selected for data binding.
This implementation always returns `null`.
